message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
private Iterator<Player> playerIterator;

public Game() {
    playerIterator = players.values().iterator();
    currentPlayerTurn = playerIterator.next();
}

public boolean endOfTurn() {
    if (!playerIterator.hasNext()) {
        playerIterator = players.values().iterator();
    }
    currentPlayerTurn = playerIterator.next();
    return true;
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use an Iterator to loop through the players. When endOfTurn is called, it checks if there is a next player in the iterator. If there isn't, it resets the iterator to the beginning of the players map. Then it sets the currentPlayerTurn to the next player in the iterator.
